name: The Bonehearted Master of Shadows (Wizard 26 / PM 10 / SD 4)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Bonehearted Master of Shadows

This build draft blends together a number of ideas:
- Wizard / PM to utilize Grizzled_Dwarflord's Damage Shield / Palemaster caster strategy (Mestil's Pale Emissary, Mestil's Half-Dead Juggernaut), but also being able to switch to the 'standard' higher AC strategy when needed (ie archers, mages)
- Shadowdancer to assist with crowd control, provide evasion
- Int 24, as I have learnt from Yunim, when capped at 36 it provides 2 bonus level 9 spells / day, (Int 22-> 34 only provides 1 bonus lvl 9 spell, in comparison)

It has three roles:
- Arcane spell casting, primarily no save casting (ie Icestorm, Evards, ILMS/IGMS, Bigbys, Summons, Damage Shields)
- Tanking both as low AC (with damage shields up) and high AC (damage shields not up)
- Scouting
SpoilerArcane spellcasting: -> Extend/Silent/Empower/Maximize, Scribe Scroll/Craft Wand, SP/GSP/ESP Tanking -> +14 bonus AC plus Epic Mage Armor / improved invisibility when one wants to have high AC -> 494hp->734hp with con capped, (dev) crit immune, fort save 38-45 against spells such as implosion with capped int -> HiPS to get you out of trouble if you go low on health Scouting -> HiPS if you get spotted, they have to try again to spot you -> Trap finding with a wand of find traps, evasion
The Shadowdancer is mostly for evasion (the other choices being Rogue 2+ or Monk 1+). But I am interested to know if HiPS is useful as I have died using GDL's damage shield strategy when I have run out of appropriate cure/healing potions and got mobbed. In my mind, HiPS could be used to reposition if invisibility wands/potions are not enough. Palemaster gets stealth abilities as a class skill, so I thought it might be nice to see if this could work well. 

It does have uncanny dodge and tumble 40 which is a little unhelpful for the damage shield strategy but tumble/dodge AC will be removed by clearing the action queue, not sure if it is also removed by drinking potions. Mobility is probably a bigger problem, providing +4 AC against attacks of opportunity. I think though there will be ways around it to keep the AC low enough so one can be hit often enough when the shields are up and you have enough healing potions. 

When a higher AC strategy is desired, uncanny dodge, dodge, tumble AC and mobility will be extremely helpful for tanking purposes.

One other thought I had was spell penetration feats + crafted magic. Do they increase spell penetration rolls if crafted magic is used against an enemy? ie a wand of ILMS (13) might have SP 19 +1d20 with epic spell penetration (+6)?

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
Orion,
The spell pen feats don't help with scrolls, wands, and potions. It's one of the several underwhelming aspects of the default magic crafting. Crafting costs, random wand charges, and pre-set caster levels fall into the same category.

As a side note, invisibility and hide unsurely overlap. With invisibility/improved invisibility, you've got the hide half of stealth covered for most circumstances (see invisibility a notable exception), but using silence to cover the silent part in painful in a wizard build. Personal preference, I would likely change the ESF: Hide for a Spell Focus, but that's a different topic and ESF: MS fits well with the build them.

All in all, another excellent build with a plethora of tools to handle any situation.
